overlapping objects and instead of simply allowing one of the colors to
sort of show through there's a custom mathematical formula that gets executed and gives you a in some cases completely
wild and wacky color so on the top left here is a normal blend mode so anytime
you specify an opacity in CSS or anything like that this is the type of blend mode that gets used you don't even

under lot do the the color that you'll see on top so multiply is fairly easy to explain you take the RGB values of the
